title: There's ONE type of champion that annoys the (excuse me) ever living shit out of me
body:
Champions that are BOTH
HYPER MOBILE
and have a shit ton of
DAMAGE


And I know I might be biased here, playing the one class whose entire justification for having a lot of damage is being IMMOBILE.

But stuff like {{champion:236}} {{champion:103}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:104}}  and co never fail to piss me off because they're so fucking slippery and have a ton of damage packed into their kit with not very obvious drawbacks except being "squishy", which most of them really aren't if you think about it.

I just had to get this off my chest, I never really feel outplayed by them, knowing they just have the advantage of having a million dashes loaded into their kit.

//end rant

Dude...

(dont give me that if she is fed she can kill anyone, if ANYONE IS FED EVER they can kill anyone)

lowest base damage?

Q 280 base damage
W 224 base damage and cannot miss
E 200 base damage i admit that this one is low but has 2 sec stun tied to it
R 450 base damage

W+Q alone deals 500 base damage, it doesn't matter if other mages can do more 500 base damage is definitly not low especially if she uses ult+buys morello and maybe luden

OP didn't say that mobile champions have more damage than immobile champions, he said that mobile champions STILL do a lot of damage and he is right

Those base damages are late game. Add that all up, and you have about over half someone's HP, while she's on the lower end of Scaling ability Ratios. 

Compare to Syndra: 

* Q: 230 damage while only needing to hit once (Ahri's needs to hit twice to get 280).

* W: 230 Base damage (While also doing 20% bonus true damage at max Rank) 276 damage

* E: 250 Base

* R: 540 damage with only the 3 Orbs from her normal ult. A single Q pushes that up to 720.

Meanwhile, let's note the diferences. Syndra can do all her abilities from 750+ Range away when level 18 (675 before). Syndra has 75%, 70%, 50%, and 60% (with 20% more per orb to her ult) scalings on all her abilities. Syndra can hit you with a stun from 1100 range away, with a high projectile speed (2500 speed on her E and Orb follow up), and stuns for 2.25 Seconds base. 

Ahri has all her scalings only has a 70% on Q (IF you hit both parts), 64% on her W (IF you hit all the bolts), 50% on her E, and 30% per dash on her ult (90% total IF she uses every dash Offensively.). Ahri's highest range ability is her E at 975 range, with Q following up at 880. Her undodgable abilities W-R are 550-600 Respectively. That is incredibly low range for a Mage.  Ahri's E speed is 1600, and can be blocked by minions, and Charms you for 2 seconds at max rank, but only 1 second at 1st rank. 

But that's late game. Let's look at how much damage they do at level 6.

Ahri does 514 damage total with both hits of Q, W, E, and all three hits from R (which means she used all her dashes offensively)

Syndra does 640 from a Single Q, W, E- and a 4 sphere Ult.

That is a 126 damage difference, and Syndra can do all that from 675 range away, while Ahri had to be within 550 range to confirm all of her damage (not to mention her W has range for each individual flame, so if a minion is within 550 range behind you, you could quite easily lose damage, once the flames start to move).

At level 6, Ahri leaves 316 health left on a 830 health target squishy, while Syndra would leave 190, which puts a huge margin of how much more it would take to kill the person. If we include level 6 ignite damage (170) , Syndra needs a single Auto attack to kill a target, while Ahri would need to land both parts of her Q, without access to her dashes or E, (or 3 basic attacks at .66 Attack Speed) 

Not to mention, due to the 1 second static CD on her dashes, her time to kill is lengthened by 2 seconds alone due to needing to hit all 3 of her dashes. Syndra's Time to kill with a Basic 4 sphere combo, can be done at optimal range within those 2 seconds alone. Ahri would need to stick around for either another Q CD, or 1.92 seconds for 3 autos (assuming they're not auto'ing during Combo, but that still adds in Time for an Auto to complete).

So yes, in context of how much effort, Ahri does do less damage than most mages, and has to hit every single aspect of her kit to do so. A missed Syndra Q still contributes 90 damage to her Ult. At level 6, there is no way for Ahri to 100-0 you within the time for Charm to wear off, so you can actually react and fight back while she stays WELL withing any Mage or Assassins range, since she is using every single Dash Offensively.

But to say that it's frustrating means you're comparing it to the idea of non-frustrating damage. And then, how do we define non-frustrating damage? If the Constant variable here is Damage, with Mobility being the trait that's the difference between some damage dealers, than you're comparing Damage to people without mobility, who instead have range/other traits. 

You can't say "This does too much damage" without having a baseline to compare that too. Because I've shown the difference between a Champ with mobility and a champ without mobility. One can actually one shot you within a CC's duration. The other can't unless fed. How is that Ahri doing burst damage.

Non-frustrating damage exists. Damage from an immobile juggernaut for example is not as frustrating because you know exactly where it's going and to stay away from it.

Getting 100-0'd is frustrating simply because you got 100-0'd. Having a large portion of your health bar destroyed by a slippery hypermobile champion is frustrating because they're hard to lock down if you survive the encounter, and you're likely going to have to back if you survive.

It's not comparing "too much damage" to "fair amount of damage". It's comparing "this feels fair" and "this is frustrating".

Comparing to my main, Xerath:

Q: Ahri's deals 40 more base damage, at the cost of 5% AP scaling. So when both champions are at 800 AP they'll do the same amount of damage, except even then Xerath will do less because half of Ahri's will be True Damage.

W: more or less a draw, reliant on hitting the target a certain way. Ahri landing 1 tick does 40 base, 20% AP less than base Xerath. Ahri landing 2 deals 2 base damage more, still 8% scaling less. Ahri landing all 3 deals 44 base more, 4% AP more. If Xerath can hit a target dead center he deals more again, an extra 46 base and 26% AP.

E: Ahri deals 5% AP more, and the duration is going to be longer unless the target is at max range.

R: Xerath out damages *if* he can use it and land enough shots, while Ahri gets auto targeting if she's in range. Comparing shot to dash, Xerath deals 110 base, 13% AP more. A lot of the difference here comes down to mobility and usability. Ahri can use her ultimate to escape and reposition, helping all her other abilities to actually land. Xerath has to stop everything else to use it. 

----

All in all, Ahri doesn't seem that far behind, and what she is behind her mobility easily makes up for.
